heading: Which country leads in the immigration from non-EU contries in the EU?
subheading: In 2022, there was an estimated 11 immigrants from non-EU countries per 1 000 residents in the EU. Malta recorded the highest rate of immigration from EU and non-EU countries in 2022 (66 immigrants per 1 000 residents). In contrast, Slovakia registered the lowest rate of immigration, with 1 immigrant per 1 000 residents.
textNote: Bulgaria, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Finland, Sweden and Liechtenstein did not include refugees from Ukraine who benefit from temporary protection in their population and migration statistics.
